| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3757](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3757 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **drow**, @, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"). The drow is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") type of [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") to his kind and is always generated as male, though their corpses are used for [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") characters that can be either male or female. Drow may turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor") while [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

A drow has two weapon attacks, with the first capable of puting targets to [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep"), and possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") like other elves.

Eating a drow [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

## Generation

Randomly generated drow are always created [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile"), and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group"). They are not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Drow are [always generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [dark elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Dark_elven_mithril-coat "Dark elven mithril-coat"), a [dark elven short sword](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)"), a [dark elven bow](/wiki/Dark_elven_bow_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven bow (SLASH'EM)"), and a stack of 3-15 [dark elven arrows](/wiki/Dark_elven_arrow_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven arrow (SLASH'EM)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Drow may appear among the [@](/wiki/Human_or_elf "Human or elf") generated within the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest")'s Chamber of Junk.

## Strategy

The drow's sleep-inducing melee attack can be very dangerous for unprepared characters, but can be completely nullified by sleep resistance and almost completely blocked by [MC3](/wiki/Magic_cancellation_\(3.4.3\) "Magic cancellation (3.4.3)"), rendering them much less threatening opponents against [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") and drow characters. Their guaranteed dark elven mithril-coat can be a useful upgrade for non-spellcasting characters until they obtain a [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters, and elven characters (who are typically not chaotic unlike in *NetHack*) will want to avoid sacrificing the corpses as well. Other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 367](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line367 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Drow (SLASH'EM)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
@ drow
Difficulty 9
Attacks Weapon 2d4 sleep, Weapon 2d4
@ drow
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Weapon 2d4 sleep, Weapon 2d4

Base level 6
Base experience 89
Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 60
Alignment −9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 800
Nutritional value 350
Size Medium
Resistances sleep
Resistances conveyed sleep (40%)

A drow:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an elf.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • may turn against you when tame.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3757

A drow, @, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM. The drow is a strong and omnivorous type of elf that is a lord to his kind and is always generated as male, though their corpses are used for drow characters that can be either male or female. Drow may turn traitor while tame.

A drow has two weapon attacks, with the first capable of puting targets to sleep, and possesses sleep resistance like other elves.

Eating a drow corpse or tin has a 2⁄5 chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

Generation

Randomly generated drow are always created hostile, and may appear in small groups. They are not a valid form for polymorph.

Drow are always generated with a dark elven mithril-coat, a dark elven short sword, a dark elven bow, and a stack of 3-15 dark elven arrows.[1]

Drow may appear among the @ generated within the Lawful Quest's Chamber of Junk.

Strategy

The drow's sleep-inducing melee attack can be very dangerous for unprepared characters, but can be completely nullified by sleep resistance and almost completely blocked by MC3, rendering them much less threatening opponents against elven and drow characters. Their guaranteed dark elven mithril-coat can be a useful upgrade for non-spellcasting characters until they obtain a dragon scale mail.

As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters, and elven characters (who are typically not chaotic unlike in NetHack) will want to avoid sacrificing the corpses as well. Other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.

References

  1. ↑ makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 367

A '''drow''', {{monsym|drow}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]] and [[SlashTHEM]]. The drow is a [[strong]] and [[omnivorous]] type of [[Elf (monster attribute)|elf]] that is a [[M2_LORD|lord]] to his kind and is always generated as male, though their corpses are used for [[Drow (starting race)|drow]] characters that can be either male or female. Drow may turn [[traitor]] while [[tame]].

A drow has two weapon attacks, with the first capable of puting targets to [[sleep]], and possesses [[sleep resistance]] like other elves.

Eating a drow [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|2|5}} chance (40%) of conveying sleep resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly generated drow are always created [[hostile]], and may appear in small [[group]]s. They are not a valid form for [[polymorph]].

Drow are [[Monster starting inventory|always generated with]] a [[dark elven mithril-coat]], a [[Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)|dark elven short sword]], a [[Dark elven bow (SLASH'EM)|dark elven bow]], and a stack of 3-15 [[Dark elven arrow (SLASH'EM)|dark elven arrows]].{{refsrc|makemon.c|367|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Drow may appear among the {{mcsl|@}} generated within the [[Lawful Quest]]'s Chamber of Junk.

==Strategy==
The drow's sleep-inducing melee attack can be very dangerous for unprepared characters, but can be completely nullified by sleep resistance and almost completely blocked by [[Magic cancellation (3.4.3)|MC3]], rendering them much less threatening opponents against [[Elf (starting race)|elven]] and drow characters. Their guaranteed dark elven mithril-coat can be a useful upgrade for non-spellcasting characters until they obtain a [[dragon scale mail]].

As elven monsters, eating their corpse or tin constitutes cannibalism for elven and drow characters, and elven characters (who are typically not chaotic unlike in ''NetHack'') will want to avoid sacrificing the corpses as well. Other characters will find drow corpses to be a useful source of sleep resistance and a decent source of nutrition.
